column4: does anybody know what to do if when i try to install ubuntu 10.04, it doesn't show any devices in the partition menu? i have some NTFS partitions, and an ext3 partition, but none show up. Tried leaving some unallocated space, maybe it will see that, but no result. If instead of installing i run ubuntu from RAM, it can see my hdd and i can mount any partition with no problems.
what if you boot the installer in "Try Ubuntu" mode and then start the installer from there?
tried that, same thing. I mounted the ext3 drive, and when i started the installer, it automatically unmounted it and didn't show anything in the list.
I think the installer keeps a log in /tmp or /var/log you should probably look there and see if there are any messages about why it hides that disk
